about_the_game:
About the Game

Immerse yourself in the eerie, atmospheric world of Silverpine Creek, inspired by Granny and latest Jumpscare games brings you a gripping horror adventure where every step could be your last. You wake up near your car, on the outskirts of a desolate village nestled in a valley surrounded by towering mountains and a rushing river. As a determined reporter, you've come to uncover the truth behind the disturbing disappearances haunting this forsaken place. But the locals’ ominous warnings echo in your mind—this village is cursed, a relic of a dark past where witch burnings persisted until the late 1900s.

Story:

The village of Silverpine Creek has been abandoned for decades, shunned by the surrounding communities. They speak of Korana, a woman who was accused of witchcraft and sentenced to burn. The ritual went terribly wrong, or so the stories go. Korana vanished, her remains never found, and now it’s said she prowls the village, a vengeful spirit responsible for the recent vanishings.

When you wake, a dense fog encircles the village, trapping you in its sinister embrace. Your only way out is to complete the final ritual and banish Korana once and for all. But beware, Korana will stop at nothing to thwart your efforts.

Gameplay:


MICROPHONE NEEDED


Korana will try to make you scream through terrifying hallucinations or by confronting you herself. But beware—your surroundings can also betray your location. Stay calm, watch your steps, ayou have 6 Days to make it out. If you fail... you fail.

Navigate through the haunted village where every object is a potential hazard. Bumping into furniture or making noise could draw Korana's attention. The environment is physics-based, meaning even the slightest disturbance could spell doom. Solve intricate puzzles, collect ritual items, and master hidden tasks to advance. Each item you find brings you closer to the final ceremony on Witch Hill, but the journey is fraught with peril. Each item you discover must be taken to the burning place on Witch Hill, where collecting all six items will initiate the final ceremony, potentially providing a way out of this nightmare. However, the journey to gather these items is fraught with peril. The game features realistic graphics enhanced with a VHS found footage aesthetic, and the binaural audio design immerses you deeper into the haunting atmosphere.

Her dark power manifests through cursed signs that induce hallucinations, revealing your location to her. Hiding is your only recourse, but she won’t be easily fooled by obvious spots.

Features:

- Immersive Horror Experience:** Explore a meticulously detailed, abandoned village filled with dark secrets and atmospheric tension.
- Physics-Based Interaction:** Every object in the environment reacts realistically, creating dynamic and unpredictable challenges.
- Stealth and Strategy:** Hide from Korana, outsmart her supernatural traps, and use the environment to your advantage.
- Puzzle Solving:** Engage with complex puzzles and riddles that unlock crucial items and secrets.
- Compelling Storyline:** Unravel the mystery of Silverpine Creek through immersive storytelling and discover the truth behind the village's curse.

Can you survive the malevolent forces at play and lift the curse of Silverpine Creek? Your wits, courage, and determination will be tested to their limits. The village waits, and Korana is watching.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10/11 x64
  • Processor: Intel/AMD
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Nvidia GTX 1650 or AMD equivalent
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 6 GB available space

short_description: Explore the chilling village of Silverpine Creek, trapped in fog and fear. Unravel its dark history as a reporter trapped within, facing the malevolent witch Korana. Realtime Physics gameplay, immersive VHS-style visuals, and reactive AI heighten the suspense in this harrowing tale of survival.
supported_languages:
English*, German, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese - Brazil, Portuguese - Portugal, Russian, Simplified Chinese, Turkish
*languages with full audio support
